Learning and Development (L&D): Mastering Employee Training & Instructional Design


Course Description


In today’s evolving corporate environment, Learning and Development (L&D) is essential for employee growth, engagement, and business success. This course is designed for HR professionals, L&D specialists, and corporate trainers who want to develop instructional design skills, implement effective employee training programs, and integrate L&D strategies into business objectives.


With a practical and strategic approach, this course explores adult learning theories, training evaluation methods, and employee development techniques to help organizations build a learning culture and maximize workforce potential.


What You’ll Learn:

• Fundamentals of Learning & Development (L&D): Gain insights into training management, corporate education, and instructional design.

• Strategic Employee Training Design: Develop learning programs that align with business needs and drive performance.

• Instructional Design Models (ADDIE, Kirkpatrick’s Model, 6Ds): Use industry-recognized frameworks to create effective training programs.

• Measuring Training Effectiveness: Learn how to evaluate L&D programs, track ROI, and improve training initiatives.

• Employee Development Strategies: Implement career development, high-potential talent programs, and leadership training.

• The Role of HR in L&D: Understand how HR professionals support corporate training, knowledge management, and succession planning.


Who Should Enroll?

• L&D Specialists & HR Professionals seeking expertise in corporate training and instructional design.

• Training Managers & Organizational Development Experts responsible for employee learning and development strategies.

• Corporate Trainers & Business Owners aiming to build scalable, high-impact L&D programs.

• Managers & Team Leaders wanting to develop coaching, mentoring, and talent development skills.

Each module provides in-depth knowledge and hands-on strategies to enhance learning experiences, optimize training outcomes, and implement effective corporate learning programs.

• Automation in Performance Reviews: Explore tools and software that can streamline the performance appraisal process, enhancing efficiency and accuracy.

courseDetails.title: Emotional Intelligence for Software Engineers and Developers
courseDetails.shortDescription: Improve your Emotional Intelligence & Boost your career growth using Success@Work model with effective Practical Tips !
courseDetails.longDescription:
As software developers, we have our image of what it means to be a good developer, and we also have a mental model of the road we started walking when we first entered the field as interns or as junior developers. Most of the time, we research what technical books to read, what courses to watch, which field to go into, web development, mobile development, or something else. The Technology, the tool - we get so involved in this wide array of choices, and so there is something very foundational that we might miss if we don’t pay enough attention and get lost in the technicality.


There is a set of skills known as “soft” skills, and that forms the 'EI' or 'Emotional Intelligence'.


Emotional intelligence is something everyone has, but which few of us really know how to channel or develop. Many Software Developers wrongly believe it to be a quality they simply don’t possess – and that if they weren’t born with it, it’s something there’s no hope of attaining later in life. But the good news for all of us is that emotional intelligence in general, and empathy in particular, are things we can train ourselves to have more of.


More and more employers are looking for coders and Software Developers who have the right set of “soft skills”, such as the ability to work well with a team, to empathize with coworkers and customers, and to de-escalate emotional situations. All of these skills require a high degree of emotional intelligence. What is emotional intelligence, and why is it important? And how can software engineers, coders and programmers develop emotional intelligence before or during their career? You’ll learn the answers to those questions in this course.

courseDetails.title: Data Mesh - A Modern Decentralized Data Management Concept
courseDetails.shortDescription: Treat 'Data as a Product' in this Enterprise level, Domain focused approach of Data Architecture !
courseDetails.longDescription:
Every year more data is produced globally. This holds also for companies: more details than ever are recorded from customers, partners, transactions, products and supply chain resulting in more data. According to IDC , “the global datasphere will grow from 45 zettabytes in 2019 to 175 by 2025”. This data forms the raw material from which organizations are drawing valuable, actionable insights. But the collection, integration and governance of this data is still one of the main challenges.

courseDetails.title: Pomodoro Technique for Effective Developers and Programmers
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master the Pomodoro Technique to Boost Your Productivity and Efficiency as a Programmer or Software Developer
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to the Pomodoro Technique for Efficient Programmers and Developers Course!

As a programmer or developer, you know that time is of the essence. You have deadlines to meet, projects to complete, and clients to satisfy. It's no secret that being productive and efficient with your time is key to achieving success in this field.

That's where the Pomodoro Technique comes in. This time management method was created in the late 1980s by Francesco Cirillo and has since become a popular tool for maximizing productivity and efficiency.

The Pomodoro Technique is based on the idea of breaking your workday into focused, 25-minute intervals called "Pomodoros," followed by short breaks. This system helps you stay focused and avoid distractions, while also ensuring that you take regular breaks to prevent burnout.

In this course, you'll learn how to use the Pomodoro Technique to become a more efficient programmer or developer. You'll discover how to set goals and prioritize tasks, how to stay focused and avoid distractions, and how to manage your time effectively.

Through a series of interactive lessons, you'll learn the key principles of the Pomodoro Technique and how to apply them to your workday. You'll also have access to a range of resources and tools to help you track your progress and stay motivated.

By the end of this course, you'll have the skills and knowledge you need to become a more productive and efficient programmer or developer. So why wait? Sign up today and start mastering the Pomodoro Technique!

courseDetails.shortDescription: Now write your Python Code Snippets directly in HTML - Taking Web Development to a whole new Level !
courseDetails.longDescription:
Are you a data scientist or a developer who mostly uses Python? Are you jealous of developers who write Javascript code and build fancy websites in a browser? How nice would it be if we could write websites in Python?


Python has grown in popularity immensely in recent years. It has a wide range of applications, from its most popular use in Artificial Intelligence, to Data Science, Robotics, and Scripting. But In the web development field, Python is used mainly on the backend with frameworks such as Django and Flask.


Before now, Python didn't have much support on the front-end side like other languages such as JavaScript. But thankfully, this year, during the PyCon 2022 conference, Peter Wang (CEO of Anaconda) announced a framework named PyScript that allows you to use Python on the web using standard HTML.

So, The only missing piece to make Python a universal programming language is here !


Think of PyScript as the “Minecraft of software development”: Users crafting their own worlds (applications) or new blocks and mods (components and widgets), and sharing them with the world.

This is the exciting beginning for supporting new ways of programming, building, sharing, and deploying applications. PyScript is a game changer and in this course we will learn everything about this awesome new tech skill - the basics, the setup, and coding in PyScript.

courseDetails.title: Job Evaluation & Grading: Build Fair Pay Salary Structures
courseDetails.shortDescription: Compensation | Salary Benchmarking | Design | Total Rewards | Equity | Job Levels | Market Data | Radford | KornFerry
courseDetails.longDescription:
The “Job Grading in a Company” course at Mike Pritula Academy is designed to equip HR professionals and organizational leaders with the skills to effectively classify and evaluate positions within their organizations. Job grading is a crucial HR tool that defines the hierarchy of roles and aligns job descriptions with market salary standards.


Course Highlights:

• Comprehensive Curriculum: The course consists of six recorded lessons, each accompanied by practical homework assignments reviewed by Mike Pritula. Topics include compensation philosophy, job analysis, salary structures, grading methods, and building pay systems linked to market data.

• Interactive Support: Enrollees gain access to a dedicated Q&A chat to discuss topics, share experiences, and receive support from peers and the course facilitator.

• Certification: Upon successful completion of the course and assignments, participants receive a diploma, enhancing their professional credentials.


Course Program:

1. The Essence of Grading and Its Benefits for Business:

Explore compensation philosophy, the connection to business objectives, the benefits of grading, and job analysis as a foundation.

2. Basics of Salaries and Compensation:

Understand fixed pay, grades and ranges, analytical and non-analytical job evaluation methods, and pay equity.

3. Options for Grading:

Learn about the Repertory Grid Method, factorial analysis, catalogue post matching, and an overview of popular techniques.

4. A Step-by-Step Process for Grading Jobs:

Identify evaluation factors, conduct job evaluations, select grade widths, and build a grading system.

5. Linking Grades to the Market:

Discover the basics of wage market overviews, selection of providers, and linking the grading system to market data.

6. Building a Pay System Based on Grades:

Create a payment policy, build ranges, conduct payroll budgeting, develop a progressive salary review matrix, and perform payroll analytics.


Who Should Enroll:


This course is ideal for HR specialists, HR managers, department heads, and anyone interested in creating an effective HR management system within their company. It’s particularly beneficial for those aiming to master job grading skills, develop fair pay systems, and enhance their professional level in HR.


Benefits of the Course:

• Practical Tools: Receive a working file for grading positions in your company, which can be used to establish grading and pay structures.

• Career Advancement: Developing expertise in job grading and compensation can lead to more strategic HR roles and increased influence within your organization.

• Expert Instruction: Learn from Mike Pritula, a seasoned HR leader with extensive experience in job evaluation and compensation strategies.


By enrolling in this course, participants will gain the knowledge and tools necessary to implement effective job grading systems, ensuring fair and competitive compensation structures within their organizations.
targetAudiences: This course is designed for HR professionals, compensation specialists, recruiters, and business leaders who want to master job grading, salary structures, and compensation planning. It is ideal for those looking to implement fair and effective pay scales, improve talent retention, and align compensation with business strategy. Beginners in HR can also benefit, as the course covers grading fundamentals and practical applications.

courseDetails.title: HR Metrics, Analytics and KPI: Data-Driven Decision Making
courseDetails.shortDescription: People Workforce Planning | Reporting | Dashboard | Scorecard | Forecast | Benchmarking | Insights | Predicting | OKR
courseDetails.longDescription:
The “HR Metrics” course at Mike Pritula Academy is designed to equip HR professionals with the skills to analyze and improve all HR processes using data-driven metrics. By understanding and applying these metrics, HR practitioners can assess the effectiveness of their processes, manage improvements, and demonstrate their value within the organization.


Course Highlights:

• Comprehensive Curriculum: The course consists of six recorded lessons, each accompanied by practical homework assignments reviewed by Mike Pritula. Topics include the role of metrics in HR management, recruitment and onboarding metrics, motivation and engagement metrics, compensation metrics, employee development and performance metrics, and employee retention and turnover metrics.

• Interactive Support: Enrollees gain access to a dedicated Q&A chat to discuss topics, share experiences, and receive support from peers and the course facilitator.

• Certification: Upon successful completion of the course and assignments, participants receive a diploma, enhancing their professional credentials.


Course Program:

1. Why HR Metrics are Needed and What Metrics to Track:

Understand the role of metrics in HR management, sources of HR metrics, necessary tools for analysis, types of metrics and analysis, stages of metrics analysis, and how to translate metrics into business solutions.

2. Recruitment, Employer Brand, and Onboarding Metrics:

Learn key recruitment and onboarding metrics, the concept of Recruiting SLA, funnel analysis using metrics, employer brand strength analysis, improving onboarding with metrics, using surveys to collect data, and calculating the cost of closing vacancies.

3. Motivation, Loyalty, Satisfaction, and Engagement Metrics:

Explore the link between metrics and business performance, tools for measuring motivation, loyalty, satisfaction, and engagement, preparing metrics reports and action plans, ready-made questionnaires, automated tools for regular measurements, and the importance of pulse questionnaires.

4. Pay Metrics (Wages, Incentives, Salary Reviews):

Discover how to obtain market data, which metrics to analyze, assessing salary competitiveness, evaluating incentive system effectiveness, calculating the required percentage of salary review, structuring pay across locations, preparing payroll budgets and analysis, and evaluating company EVP.

5. Metrics for Employee Development and Performance:

Identify metrics that assess employee performance, evaluate training programs, measure employee development and career paths, and metrics for working with high-potential employees and talent pools.

6. Employee Retention and Turnover Metrics:

Learn how to calculate turnover, analyze turnover in different segments, forecast turnover, identify real causes of turnover using regression analysis, estimate employee retention rates, and implement exit interviews and retention surveys.


Who Should Enroll:


This course is ideal for HR professionals who want to learn how to work with HR metrics and analyze them to drive improvements. It’s particularly beneficial for those seeking practical tools and strategies to enhance their organization’s HR processes through data-driven decision-making.


Benefits of the Course:

courseDetails.longDescription:
Conflict Management & Emotional Intelligence: Master Conflict Resolution in the Workplace


Develop expert conflict resolution skills, strengthen emotional intelligence, and master difficult conversations for effective leadership.


Conflicts are inevitable in any organization. Whether it’s misunderstandings between team members, leadership struggles, or personal disputes, mastering conflict management is essential for maintaining a productive and positive workplace. This course provides a comprehensive framework to identify, prevent, and resolve workplace conflicts while enhancing your emotional intelligence, negotiation skills, and active listening abilities.


By learning conflict resolution techniques, mediation strategies, and communication best practices, you’ll gain the skills to de-escalate tensions, manage difficult conversations, and foster a collaborative work environment.


What You’ll Learn:

• Understanding Conflict in Teams: Explore the nature, psychology, and core elements of workplace conflicts.

• Types of Conflict: Identify the various conflict categories, their triggers, and how they escalate.

• Emotional Intelligence in Conflict Management: Develop self-awareness, self-regulation, and empathy to manage workplace disputes effectively.

• Conflict Prevention Techniques: Learn strategies for proactively assessing, mitigating, and preventing workplace conflicts.

• Negotiation & Mediation: Master negotiation tactics and conflict mediation strategies to resolve disputes amicably.

• Managing Difficult Conversations: Gain confidence in handling sensitive topics and influencing conflict outcomes.

• Workplace Conflict Resolution: Understand organizational conflict patterns, leadership responses, and team dynamics.

• Dealing with Toxic Work Environments: Learn how to manage difficult employees, workplace politics, and internal disputes.


Course Program: Comprehensive Conflict Management Training


Class 1: Understanding Conflict in Teams

• What conflict is made up of and why it’s a natural part of human interaction.

• The psychology of conflict and how people react to disputes.

• The common causes of conflict in workplace teams and leadership structures.


Class 2: Types of Conflict and Conflict Escalation

• Understanding different types of workplace conflicts and how they develop.

• The process of conflict escalation and intervention strategies.

• Classification of conflicts and how to apply conflict resolution frameworks effectively.


Class 3: Conflict Triggers & Managerial Responses

• Why workplace conflicts arise and how they impact organizational culture.

• How managers should handle conflict to avoid escalation.

• Proactive conflict prevention techniques and team-building strategies.


Class 4: Workplace Conflict Scenarios & Resolutions

• Common HR-related conflicts and leadership challenges.

• Issues caused by poor work organization and process inefficiencies.

• Personal problems impacting work performance and how to address them.

• Workplace politics, nepotism, and organizational power struggles.


Class 5: Conflict Prevention & Resolution in Organizations

• Assessing team conflict potential with structured evaluation tests.

• Conflict mediation techniques to address disputes before escalation.

• Guidelines and workplace policies to minimize disputes.


Class 6: Negotiation & Mediation for Conflict Resolution

• Key conflict resolution strategies and when to apply them.

• Techniques for negotiating win-win outcomes in disputes.

• Mediation best practices for managers, HR professionals, and leaders.


Why Take This Course?

Learn expert-backed conflict resolution techniques and apply them immediately in your workplace.

Strengthen emotional intelligence and improve your ability to navigate difficult conversations.

Gain leadership skills to foster a collaborative and conflict-free work environment.

Receive a certification in conflict management and resolution, enhancing your career prospects.


Who Is This Course For?

• HR professionals managing workplace disputes and employee relations.

• Team leaders and managers responsible for handling interpersonal conflicts.

• Business professionals looking to improve negotiation and conflict resolution skills.

• Executives and senior leaders aiming to create a conflict-resilient corporate culture.

• Anyone seeking to master conflict resolution, mediation, and difficult conversation skills.


Enroll today and develop the skills to manage workplace conflicts, improve team dynamics, and become a conflict resolution expert!

courseDetails.longDescription:
Project Management Mastery: Practical Approach with PMBOK 7 Principles


Course Description


Project management is essential for business leaders, HR professionals, and managers to execute strategic initiatives and optimize workflows. This course follows a structured approach to project planning, execution, stakeholder management, risk assessment, and teamwork, integrating PMBOK 7 principles and domains to ensure project success.


By the end of this course, you will have hands-on project management skills and the ability to plan, execute, monitor, and close projects efficiently.


What You’ll Learn:

- Understand the fundamentals of project management and its four key stages.

- Develop and create successful projects, from ideation to business case preparation.

- Engage and manage stakeholders effectively, prioritizing their interests and influence.

- Define project scope and boundaries to ensure clarity and focus.

- Plan projects using structured frameworks, including risk assessment and time scheduling.

- Manage project resources, budgets, and costs to optimize efficiency.

- Master teamwork and leadership in a project environment for better collaboration.

- Monitor and control project progress with reporting systems and evaluation techniques.

- Close projects successfully, integrating PMBOK 7 principles for comprehensive project completion.


Who Should Enroll?

• Project Managers & Business Leaders – Professionals responsible for leading and delivering successful projects.

• HR Professionals & Organizational Leaders – Those managing HR projects, strategic initiatives, and process improvements.

• Entrepreneurs & Business Owners – Individuals aiming to develop structured business projects and drive operational efficiency.

• Aspiring Project Managers – Those seeking to gain practical project management skills based on PMBOK 7 principles.

• Anyone involved in managing projects, regardless of industry, looking to improve planning, execution, and risk management.


Course Structure & Modules:


This course consists of 10 in-depth classes, focusing on different PMBOK 7 domains and practical project management techniques.


Class 1: Fundamentals of Project Management & PMBOK 7 Overview

• Understanding project management stages and principles

• The role & responsibilities of a project manager

• Overview of PMBOK 7 principles & domains


Class 2: Creating a Project – From Business Case to Implementation

• How to collect ideas, develop a business case & conduct a cost-benefit analysis

• Selecting a project for implementation

• Integrating accountability, ethics & stakeholder considerations


Class 3: Stakeholder Management & Engagement

• Identifying project stakeholders & prioritizing engagement

• Strategies for stakeholder influence & interest management

• Applying the Stakeholder Interests domain from PMBOK 7


Class 4: Project Scope & Defining Boundaries

• Setting clear project start & end points

• Defining project assumptions and expectations

• Integrating the Development & Delivery domain


Class 5: Project Planning & Risk Identification

• Dividing the project into phases for structured execution

• Risk assessment & identification techniques

• Time planning methodologies & risk mitigation strategies


Class 6: Scheduling & Human Resource Planning

• Project scheduling & duration estimation

• Gantt charts & Human Resource Matrices

• Applying PMBOK 7’s Teamwork domain


Class 7: Budgeting & Resource Allocation

• Project cost estimation, budget planning & risk factors

• The three stages of project budgeting

• Applying Project Measurement & Uncertainty principles


Class 8: Teamwork & Leadership in Project Execution

• Defining roles & responsibilities of project team members

• Launching & managing effective project teams

• Integrating leadership & teamwork principles from PMBOK 7


Class 9: Project Monitoring, Control & Reporting

• Tracking project progress & cost monitoring

• Managing deviations & reporting project performance

• Applying Project Evaluation & Adaptation strategies


Class 10: Project Closure & Final Evaluation

• Administrative procedures for closing a project

• Reviewing project deliverables & integrating lessons learned

• Applying all PMBOK 7 principles for effective project closure


Why Take This Course?

- Practical Learning Approach – Focused on real-world project management techniques & PMBOK 7 applications.

- Expert Instruction – Taught by Mike Pritula, a recognized leader in business & HR project management.

- Hands-On Experience – Work on case studies, assignments & project planning exercises.

- Certification Upon Completion – Earn a diploma to showcase your project management expertise.


Enroll Today & Master Project Management for Business & HR Success!


Want to improve your project management skills and lead successful projects? This course provides practical tools, structured methodologies, and industry insights to help you plan, execute, and manage projects efficiently.


Enroll now and take your project management career to the next level!
